official-title.#text:
To establish a procedure to safeguard the surpluses of
		  the Social Security and Medicare hospital insurance trust
		  funds.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on the

, for a period to
			 be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of
			 such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee
			 concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Social Security and Medicare
			 Protection Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The

Social Security
			 and Medicare surpluses should be reserved for strengthening and preserving the
			 Social Security trust funds; and

preserving Social
			 Security and Medicare surpluses would restore confidence in the long-term
			 financial integrity of Social Security and Medicare.

It is the purpose of this Act to prevent
			 the Social Security and Medicare hospital insurance trust funds from being used
			 for any purpose other than providing retirement and health security.

header.#text:
Protection of
			 Social Security and Medicare surpluses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following
			 new section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Title III of the
			 Congressional Budget Act of 1974

header.#text:
Protection of
			 Social Security and Medicare surpluses

Protection for Social Security and hospital insurance
		  surpluses

Protection for Social
				Security and hospital insurance Surpluses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to consider any concurrent resolution on the
				budget, or an amendment thereto or conference report thereon, that would set
				forth a surplus for any fiscal year that is less than the combined surpluses of
				the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund, the Federal Old-Age and Survivors
				Insurance Trust Fund, and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund for that
				fiscal year.

text.#text: It shall not be in order in the

continuation-text.#text:
would
				cause the surplus for any fiscal year covered by the most recently agreed to
				concurrent resolution on the budget to be less than the combined surpluses of
				the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund, the Federal Old-Age and Survivors
				Insurance Trust Fund, and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund for that
				fiscal year.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to consider any bill, joint resolution,
				amendment, motion, or conference report if—

the enactment of

the adoption and
				enactment of that amendment; or

the enactment of
				that bill or resolution in the form recommended in that conference
				report,
